website_summaries.verdict: High-quality restoration kit that is easy to use and includes a UV-blocking coating.
pros: The UV coating in the kit will protect the headlights for a long time, preventing re-oxidation
Includes all of the materials you need to sand and restore the lenses in the headlights
Requires less than an hour to complete the restoration process
cons: Only enough materials to clean 2 headlights, so price is a little high

customer_reviews.title: Seller doesn't honor warranty
customer_reviews.text: The product worked well. The lights started to fade after a year. Contacted seller and they refused to help. If you can't honor "life time" warranty, why put that in your main item description?
customer_reviews.author: Teetar

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Last
customer_reviews.text: Used this product back in Nov 2018. Instructions were adequate, process fairly easy, results were impressive.......and then a couple of months went by and the application started to look hazy and streaks were quite visible. See attached pic. I'm assuming the lifetime warranty promise will be a real pain in the butt to get honored, so I'll eat the $20 and look for the next miracle too-good-to-be-true product on the market. Update 8/19: The lenses are now yellow and frosty looking. It appears that the clearcoat, used in the final step of the process, is faded out, and the lenses look worse than before I use the kit. I will now try the 3M Headlight Restore Kit.
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: Life time warranty
customer_reviews.text: 5 star review drops to 1 star! I bought this product based on the good reviews to restore my 2004 Pacifica headlights. Followed the directions carefully and got excellent results at first. Fast forward about 1 year later and the lights are looking bad again. I am disappointed and would like to have a refund or replacement product. I attached photos to show how the product is failing after a year.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Follow instructions.
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing to know about this product is the sanding process. It must be done thoroughly; most plastic headlamps have very small cracks due to sun damage, they have to be sanded out as much as possible. If the sanding is done right and the instructions are followed the head lamp can be restored up to 98% of it’s original condition. When applying the clear, wipe it on once and don’t touch it again. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carrano

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product . Doesn’t work as advertised . My car from headlights are a mess now . Worse than what it was before . Did follow the instructions and still there were scratches in the headlights . Tried reaching user no response . Waste of time and money .
customer_reviews.author: Sri

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This kit RUINED my lenses! Do not use it on clear headlight lenses like it has in the picture! I used it exactly how the instructions said and I will now have to buy completely new lenses because they are RUINED. It requires you to sand down your lenses making them scratched and foggy forever! Use a degreaser from a different company and stay away from this kit, you’ll thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSIVE RESULT BUT FORGET WARRANTY
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use and required minimal exertion. I had one new-looking headlight and one cloudy one. Now they both look new. One issue with the instructions: they imply the job is finished before applying the last coating. Actually the lens is cloudy until you apply the UV protective coating. Despite the satisfactory result, the product gets a punitive ONE STAR because the "LIFETIME WARRANTY" link doesn't work. The warranty is a major selling point; there are cheaper products out there. If the product fails in the future...you will hear about it.
customer_reviews.author: K. B.

customer_reviews.title: Last a year at most. Now the headlights are a mess
customer_reviews.text: .This didn't last but a year. The headlights began flaking, and now the look like a foggy mess. This was a terrible idea and I wish I'd never used the Sylvania kit. It is a temporary fix, at best, for people who just want to sell a car. If you actually want it to last, look for something else. Edit: I contacted Sylvania, who claims to offer a warranty. They did not reply. That is a deadbeat move.
customer_reviews.author: Baconologist

customer_reviews.title: Worth the work
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my 2003 BMW 325i. The headlights were so yellowed I failed the Maryland safety inspection. All the reviews are true to form. Yes, it's a fair amount of work, but the result is really worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rory M.

customer_reviews.title: Instructions misleading
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use. Took about 40 minutes to completely restore two headlights on a 15 year old Toyota. The instructions are misleading. It states the customer is to provide 400, 1000 and 2000 grit sandpaper. In the step by step instructions it states to use 1000, 2000, and 3000 grit sandpaper. I used the former since it was what I wrote down when I went to the store to purchase wet sandpaper. 400, 1000, 2000 worked fine. I am impressed with the results. We'll see how long the headlights look newer.
customer_reviews.author: BJack

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat frustrating
customer_reviews.text: This product took about 45 minutes to an hour to use. It involves sanding your lens covers 4 different times and applying 2 different liquid solutions. So far, I am pleased with the result. Ridiculously, Sylvania did not bother to include any instructions whatsoever in the box. Apparently, they used to include a roll of black electrical tape to use to protect the paint around your headlights. However, no tape whatsoever was included when I recently bought the kit. I used blue painters tape, but this came off when wet. Come on Sylvania!
customer_reviews.author: Ski Cat

customer_reviews.title: Ok until you have a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This product actually works pretty well, until you have an issue. The bottle of UV clearcoat in last box I bought was dried solid and unusable. You can't return this product to Amazon, you have to contact Sylvania, which is basically impossible. They don't answer the phone or return calls, and the link to their customer support form doesn't work. Wasted money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Sturm

customer_reviews.title: Warning, grits are European standard ("P" ) and not US standard!!!
customer_reviews.text: The product works, we will see about durability. You only really need to purchase the activator and UV coating kit. The 'full' kit is excessive. A few further notes. -The activator smells like Windex and there is not enough. -The UV coat has about twice as you end up using. -The grits are 'European standard' / ISO/FEPA - this is designated 'P'. So you get P400, P1000, and P2000 in the CAMI or US standard this is roughly 320, 500-600, and 1000. To get a good finish one really needs to go to a higher grit. The rubbing compound, I am not sure, but I am sure you could get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: electricquad

customer_reviews.title: Sylvania Headlight Restoration Kit
customer_reviews.text: Although a real workout sanding and rubbing the lenses, the final results are well worth the labor. The directions are very clear and concise. If you follow them to the tee, you can expect great results. My lenses were so foggy, night driving became dangerous, especially living in white tail deer country. Now they look brand new and I feel much safer. If you can do the work outside, that is best, as there is a lot of water involved and some solvent odor. I did mine in the garage as it was cold outside. If you don't mind putting in the elbow grease required for this procedure, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Semore Blues

customer_reviews.title: Save your time, Save your money invest in it professionally done.
customer_reviews.text: Let's just say it no walk in the park, 1st headlight took a little over an hour.. between. The sanding and polishing, 2nd one about the same time. With the time taken on both I could have easily driven down and had them professionally done. Each for $40 a peice. As far as sheerness, if you dont get the clear coat done right the 1st time the whole job is shot !!, and last but not least how long will it last? I'm not even sure .... we shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: I finally got around to using this on my 2002 Toyota Highlander that had headlights that were very clouded and hazy. The steps are a little tedious and it helped watching a video. But, my goodness the end result was amazing...... the headlights are now perfectly clear and look brand new. It far exceeded my expectation and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: john d

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the results.
customer_reviews.text: The product worked precisely as described and produced a beautiful finish. I have two recommendations. When wet sanding, periodically stop and dry the lens off. This will allow you to see exactly where it may be uneven. Also, if it’s hot outside, be sure you are not leaning over the lens as you work on it. I was spreading on the protective coating and a drop of sweat landed on it, messing it up. I was able to fix it, but it left a slight imperfection.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Bought this after watching YouTube review
customer_reviews.text: Watched the Project Farm review of headlight restoration kits and this won the challenge. Followed the directions to the letter. Lots of water during the sanding process. Will take 20 minutes per headlight. Got to the last step and the headlights were hazy until I put the sealer on. Then....WOW! The headlights on my '13 Tacoma are literally as good a new. They were not totally hazed over before I did the restoration but were far enough along to be noticeable. I have used Maguires and 3M on other vehicles and had decent results, definitely better. The Sylvania kit was stunning. I think the UV protectant at the end is what really sets it apart from other kits.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Warren

customer_reviews.title: Works for a few weeks... :(
customer_reviews.text: It took about an hour for me to complete the process-following directions step by step and WOW they looked amazing.... for a few weeks. They are looking pretty much the same again, maybe not quite as bad as they originally did but pretty close. I only tried this kit because of the great reviews. May be I needed to sand longer? That's the only thing I can think of that I would do longer just to see if that was the issue. But like I said I spent an hour step by step. Overall disappointed. I'll probably try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: petlovr

customer_reviews.title: Leaking bottle upon arrival!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how well this product works but it came in an undamaged box with one of its bottles that had leaked all over. I would change my review if I actually used the product!
customer_reviews.author: Reece M

customer_reviews.title: Not a strong performer.
customer_reviews.text: Consumer Reports magazine tested 4 different brands of headlight restorer. Sylvania was the only one deemed worth the cost, so I bought the kit on Amazon. Not quite what I was hoping for. It cleaned the haze off our 13-year-old Subaru Baja, but the haze returned after about 18 months. Should they have remained clear for several years? I don't know, but that is what I was expecting So I ordered a pair of brand new headlights & switched them out. That's my suggested solution to hazy headlights. Maybe you will have better results than I did with the Sylvania product.
customer_reviews.author: Wm E Kirk

customer_reviews.title: "3 Easy Steps"  not really...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time using this for one of my cars. Lifetime warrantee, good luck. Consumer Reports this as the best of all they tested so I'll stick with it. Lasted about 3 1/2 years in FL on a car that spends most of its time in the garage. As for the 3 steps, follow the instructions and a little elbow grease and the results are excellent. Be sure to get plenty of the sealer on the entire edge of the cloth that will touch the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Fester

customer_reviews.title: Works amazingly well to restore headlight lens
customer_reviews.text: I saw the videos and read all the positive reviews. I was expecting it to work well, but I'm blown away at how good my headlight lens look! They provide everything in the box down to a vinyl glove and special towels for the application process. No tools required. The only thing I supplied were lots of paper towels, painters tape, and a spray bottle (and water). It took me about an 1.5 hours to complete. There's a video from Sylvania and the instructions that are included are very clear. I recommend watching the video and reading the instructions before you start. I learned some things watching the video that weren't in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Nohkul

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, restored visibility and looks
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well, but not perfectly. It was a huge improvement but there are still some imperfections that only I would notice or someone was inches away. After a couple months they don't appear to be clouding up again but it's nice to know that there is a lifetime warranty. Will update later if things change. Take your time with this and follow the instructions and you will be good. I was happy with how easy they made the application process.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted nearly 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of other people have left reviews of how well it works the day you do that work. I'll echo that it's labor-intensive, but I followed the directions and everything came out great. I'm leaving this review to let you know that in my experience, it's lasted 21 months so far and still looks great.
customer_reviews.author: toddrf

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: A body shop owner told me that the headlight lens polishing kits only worked well on barely foggy headlight lens, and that mine were way past that. I tried this kit on the recommendation of a youtube comparison video. I followed the directions exactly with this kit. It took about two hours. I am not sure taping the area off made any difference because the tape was loose in many areas from the intermittent rinsing done during the process of polishing. In the end, the headlight lens both looked like new! That is correct, new, not just better. And by the way, I almost never bother to write reviews, either positive or negative.
customer_reviews.author: 1255x255

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING  product. I love it so much
customer_reviews.text: its an amazing difference how much this works on the headlight. I've had my car for 9 years and didn't really think to ever clean the headlight but my bulb went out for the first time last week so I replaced it and I thought why not clean it up see if it helps me drive at night. I bought his, followed the simple instruction and wow, the difference. I thought I was looking at a brand new car if I was only judging based on the headlight. It's crystal clear and beautiful again. Right after i finished my car i came back and bought another one to do my girlfriend's car.
customer_reviews.author: Long Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: 1 hour labor for me
customer_reviews.text: Used this on the front headlights and it became foggy while I was using it but it was a normal process. It took a while for me to get finished since I wanted the headlights to turn out perfectly. After an hour and additional time used beyond the instruction requirements, the results were perfect. Since I didn't need the car after I was done, I just let it sit there parked for the night. In the morning I was really happy to see my headlights shining under the sunlight. The kit was just enough for my front headlights so try not extend it to other parts of the car if you want the same great results evenly.
customer_reviews.author: C Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Good for a year
customer_reviews.text: Overall the product does a good job, but only last about a year. If I hadn't used it previously the markings on the elements of the product could have been very confusing.. Both the step number1 element and the step number 3 element were marked the same (in other words there were two steps both marked number 1). A first time used could easilt believed that a part/element was missing. They need to inspect the labeling inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: This is the cream of the crop.
customer_reviews.text: After watching some YouTube reviews comparing headlight restoration kits, I decided to try a best-of-breed approach using the abrasives from a 3M kit, and the chemicals from Sylvania. I'm not disappointed at all. The prep fluid seemed to do what it was supposed to, but the star of the show was that final coat and UV protectant. I've done headlight restorations using other kits before, but never been all that satisfied, but this stuff knocks it out of the park. If you put in the effort with various grit sandpaper and prep for the final coat from this kit, you will be rewarded handsomely. 15 year old headlights came out looking like they should have on the showroom floor.
customer_reviews.author: Lampshade

customer_reviews.title: It works amazingly well.
customer_reviews.text: I sent it to my college age (19) daughter for her 20 plus year old car with very yellowed lenses that I was worried about night driving. I could not believe how well this worked- the next time I saw the car the headlight lenses looked brand new. I would also have to say that it must have been fairly easy to use, because-even though ii know my kid is meticulous about things- I think she would have told me if she had had any difficulty using the stuff and getting the results that she did. So I would say that there wasn't a huge amount of elbow grease, time, or unreasonable to do instructions involved. highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: kpdrumswritessings

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my headlight looks like new
customer_reviews.text: My wife had a fender bender and the passenger headlight was replaced during the repair. This made the driver's side light look even more yellow and dingy. After researching I bought this product and was very happy with the results. You apply several different polishing compounds and use the included wetsand sandpaper for 5 minutes on each application. It will look scratched up until you put the final clearcoat on. That is what leaves it looking like new. Make sure when you put the clearcoat on you put it on evenly and don't touch it until it dries. If you touch it too early, it will leave a fingerprint. Now my headlight looks like new and has for several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Krecklau

customer_reviews.title: This works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Follow the instructions. My headlights were very yellow and fogged just by normal wear and tear and this kit made them look good as new. Will work for two headlights but would not recommend trying to stretch the components any further than that. They say to sand for about five minutes with each grit level which seems a bit optimistic to me and realistically you can expect at least ten minutes per. A little extra effort on your part will pay off in a big way with the finished product. When the UV sealer / top coat was applied I was very happy with the results and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Yetimonster

customer_reviews.title: Have a second person and put on some music.
customer_reviews.text: It really helps to have 2 people. Change sides after 3 minutes so that each of you work on each headlight. You will be doing this several times as you keep using different grades of sanding paper. Have 2 buckets of water, some rags and a roll of paper towels. Work in the shade and not on a windy day. You only put on one layer of the last clear coat. There was more than I thought in the little bottle and I had a lot left over, but you can’t put on a second coat. I could have put it on a bit more generously. It looks great though. My Toyota dealer wanted $500 to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Loves comfortable shoes

customer_reviews.title: Best headlight restoration available.
customer_reviews.text: Just got done with mine and turned my faded lights into clear glass. I probably spent 1 hour on each headlight wet sanding them. I recommend very light pressure and water and little time with the 400 grit as I personally feel is to course. Most of your time will be done sanding with the 1000 and 2000 grits. Make sure you have a spray bottle with you as well as paper towels. Very nice kit though will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Kris Hall

customer_reviews.title: My car is garage parked so the drivers side wasn't horrible but it was noticeable when compared to the new ...
customer_reviews.text: The passenger side of my 2004 car was in a wreck recently and the auto body couldn't find a used headlight so they had to install a new one. I bought the kit to see if I could the 14 year old driver side to match the brand new side. My car is garage parked so the drivers side wasn't horrible but it was noticeable when compared to the new one. I watched the video on the sylvania website first and followed the instructions. The drivers side looks better but it doesn't quite have the bright sparkle of a new headlight. So in summary, NOT like new but still very good.
customer_reviews.author: Home Handy Man

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great.
customer_reviews.text: I've never refurbished headlight lenses before, so I can't compare this product to others. And it's only been a couple of days so I can't really say (yet) how well it holds up. That being said, the results are FANTASTIC. The lenses look amazing. It stops me in my tracks every time I go out to the driveway. All told, it probably took me 45-60 minutes to do both headlights. There's a lot of sanding and rubbing. Your hand may get a bit cramped at the end of it. The instructions were clear and easy to follow and the results speak for themselves. I would definitely recommend this to anyone with an older car.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Clarkson

customer_reviews.title: Keep the faith. The last step is where the magic happens.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a used car whose headlights were really messed up- we are talking material flaking off (probably a bad UV coat). It was awful. Replacing the headlamp assemblies would be about $2000, so I went for this kit. My only criticism is that the sandpaper wasn't sufficient in my case. The first pass wasn't working and I ended up using 200 grit with a random orbital sander to get all the cruft off. Once this was done I went through the sanding and polishing steps. When I was done, the lights were still hazy and I was somewhat forlorn. But then I applied the UV coating and was amazed by the difference. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this kit on my wifes 2011 Ford edge. The drivers side lamp was much worse than passenger because of the way sun shines on driveway. Both sides turned out looking the same. I'm not sure how long this will last so I couldn't give it anything other than 5 stars. I have used other kits on other vehicles and they didn't turn out as well. Keep in mind this setup will require more elbow grease than kits with drill attachment. With the shape of most modern lenses this could be a plus. The drill attachments can be dangerous in the wrong hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE Product. None of us can really believe the results!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I'll keep this brief by using some pics that will show why a five star rating is justified. As they say, "a picture is worth a thousand words." The application process was simple: It took me about thirty minutes to complete both headlights. These headlights are on a 2002 Suzuki XL7 SUV. Yes, that's what truly amazes me. I was able to remove fifteen years of UV exposure damage in thirty minutes! Again, WOW!! One last comment; I would strongly recommend you view the Sylvania instructional video. Actual website is osram-americas, NOT what is printed on the bottom back of the product package. Just use their search engine and look for Headlight Restoration Kit...
customer_reviews.author: Ward N

customer_reviews.title: Save your money! This really works!!!
customer_reviews.text: Took 1.5 hours for the entire process. Hubby followed the directions and it came out soooo good! My headlight covers on our 12 yr old Honda Odyssey were so foggy you couldn’t even see the headlights! This was out last ditch effort before we spilled $400 on brand new headlights. Well, it’s not money saved!! From what I hear, there’s sanding and coating involved but directions are easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: G Ko

customer_reviews.title: Good Product - Buy Wet/Dry Sandpaper - Apply UV Solution Only Once
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product and I am satisfied with the results. My headlight and driving light lenses were completely fogged. Now my lights are brighter at night and they sparkle during the day. Suggestions - (1.) Use wet/dry sanding blocks. The kit does not come with sandpaper. I used what was available which was 320, 1500 and 2000 grit sanding blocks. (2.) When applying the UV solution, follow the instructions and use enough solution and wiping stroke to wipe the area only once. Do not go over the wiped area more than once. If you do, it will leave a noticeable streak.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: I can See again!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st time using a headlight cleaner so I can speak for other brands, but this product is Awesome! I was able to bring my lights back to life and they look Brand New again. I chose this product over others as it had the most amount of steps to ensure the lights were brought back to life. 1st step is the cleaner, then onto 3 types of sandpaper, then a rubbing compound to buff it out and finally a UV protector. The lights will look hazy until you put on the UV protector, once you do...it's like BAM...brand new again!
customer_reviews.author: Paul M

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: This is an 05 Camry from FL with bad UV damage to the headlight lenses. I was going to buy new ones but decided to give this a try first. It's essentially a week sanding process that took about a half hour total start to finish with great results. I watched the tutorial video on youtube first as the final step of applying the new UV protector wasnt perfectly clear to me in the instructions. The video was a great resource to clarify everything. I followed the instructions to the letter and was very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: JPN

customer_reviews.title: Did a great job on my old faded headlights
customer_reviews.text: I have a 20-year old Honda CR-V whose headlights had clouded over terribly. A lot of "home remedies" for this were offered to me by friends, but I saw this product reviewed in a Popular Mechanics article as the best solution. The headlights now look like new, but more importantly, they shine a much brighter and clearer light on the road ahead of me. Do this when you have some time to spare (at least a half-hour), outside (some of the chemicals have fumes), and read the instructions over carefully before you start.
customer_reviews.author: Murphus

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the results of this product on my ‘06 Civic. I’ve never done this before so I imagine that with a bit of practice I could do an even better job next time. For the price and time it took to do this myself, why would I pay the dealership to do this for me? The price they wanted was silly. I followed the video on YouTube and that was really helpful. I see from some reviews that this isn’t a one time fix but that’s fine. I wish the headlight cover was made of glass like my 2001 truck. Those lights look perfect after 18 + years. Anyway, glad to have clear headlights again!
customer_reviews.author: F.S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product; more time means better results
customer_reviews.text: This kit works INCREDIBLY well. My headlights on a 10 year old Jetta look brand new now (unless you get really close and see some scratches I couldn't sand out) It took considerably longer than I expected (about an hour and a half) due to my lights being heavily oxidized. The extra time, patience, and using up a good portion of my elbow grease reserves really paid off. The final UV curing step is really where the magic is though. After curing, it makes the lights crystal clear NOTE: This review was created about a week after application. I'll be doing a followup down the road (lol) for longevity
customer_reviews.author: Luke F

customer_reviews.title: Expect 2 hrs to do the job, avoid dew and rain at all cost when final coat is curing.
customer_reviews.text: Most of the steps in the instructions will say "...for at least five minutes..." but expect to spend longer than that to do a good job. Even lights with mild oxidation take longer than 5 min per step. Masking off the surfaces around the lights adds time and is stupid NOT to do. Use lots and lots of water from a spray bottle. Lots. Took me over 2 hours to do both of my headlights and they weren't in horrible shape and I've used kits like this before. Finished product was very good, best yet. Time will tell how well it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: N. Oldenburgh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Clarity When Complete
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great. The clarity of the headlight lenses was much, much better. It has been about 6 weeks since I did the job and they still look great. It does require a lot of elbow grease and some time but it was worth it. I would have preferred a product that could be used with a motorized sanding pad but the reviews on You Tube indicted this product had the best results. The review rated this product #1 and the 3M product #2. Knowing 3M products are the top of the line it was a hard choice. I am happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: GPHR69

customer_reviews.title: Freaking magic
customer_reviews.text: I legit can not believe it. THIS THING IS MAGIC. my pickup truck head lights had seen it better days, and the headlights were so bad, you couldn't even see the inside bulb because of how cloudy it was. I did this for one side 2 times(2 times only for one package) and it looked brand freaking new, I'm buying another one as we speak for my other cars.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: First time ever and it worked beautifully
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time ever attempting to restore headlights. The directions are very easy to follow and it states a lifetime warranty on it. My headlights look like they are brand new and are crystal clear! It did take me about two hours total, including taping- tape not included in package I bought it separately. Then there is a 4-6 hour curing time that you can't drive during. I did mine in the afternoon and let it cure overnight. The sandpaper was slightly challenging to hold and my arms got tired but I am not strong or have much endurance.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Not so much....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product and followed instructions and it came out a "little" better than it looked initially. Now it is 6-8 weeks in (we park inside a garage does not stay outside unless we take it somewhere) and the lights are as bad as they were :( We found out after we had purchased this product that for just a little more money we could have had a professional do the job. That will be our next avenue.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product to clear up cloudy headlights
customer_reviews.text: We used this product twice over the past few weeks: first on a 2005 4Runner and then a 2012 Impreza. Both times it completely restored the headlights to factory newness and only took about an hour to do each one (perfect afternoon quarantine project TBH). No tools are required and the instructions are incredibly detailed, so almost anyone can do this to their car to refresh their cloudy headlights. Recommend taping off around the headlights during the sanding process to protect the paint, but other than that the kit comes with pretty much everything else you need to complete the project.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Headlights look great
customer_reviews.text: 2007 Honda CR-V. I bought the kit last year. I never got to use it and it got misplaced. Found it I reread instructions and watched the video. It was like they said. Headlights turned white in the process. The last step changed everything. The headlights look new again. It makes the car look a lot nicer. My biggest concern was for night driving. I have not done that yet but as clear as the headlights are I expect a lot better visibility. I would recommend this product. I am hoping that it holds up well to the weather. The car is not garaged,
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic lens cleaning kit by Sylvania
customer_reviews.text: Bought my kit back in Sept 2018 and kept pushing off using for fear of messing up the headlights further and couldn't find time to do it. Finely today Sept 12, 2020 I finely did it. My SUV is 14 years old and had really bad lights. After reading the instructions several times (I'm 77) and following step by step I finished the task. Holly S%#2, they lights look like they did back in 2006 in the show room. If you follow the instructions carefully, you can't go wrong. I am 110% satisfied. Trust me, this is an excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Tara Achenbach

customer_reviews.title: Like Glass
customer_reviews.text: I used this to seal up my lenses AFTER a 3M restoration kit. My light were VERY cloudy. Used the sandpaper type restoration kit, AFTER that, this as a sealer. This is the final touch. Made them look HARD and super clear- like glass. Been 6 months, over winter, still nice and clear. IMPORTANT!!!! Get it done right the first time. Wipe it on thick and smooth and fairly quickly. DON'T go back for touch ups! This stuff melts the plastic, if you go back over it YOU WILL see streaks. Nissan Truck
customer_reviews.author: twaters

customer_reviews.title: Headlights now look as good as new
customer_reviews.text: Easier project than I thought. It took a little over an hour but mostly because I didn't want to make a mistake and kept referring to the how-to video on the manufacturer's website. I did both headlights on my 2004 4Runner. I opted to use blue masking tape around the headlights, which protected during sanding. Be sure to frequently apply water during the wet sanding steps. There is plenty of extra UV sealant (you will not run out) so be sure to wet both sides of your blue cloth to ensure a good coating gets applied. When they say it'll look brand new they aren't kidding. Hopefully the UV coating will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B

customer_reviews.title: After 1.5 years, starting to get cloudy appearance
customer_reviews.text: I spent a couple hours applying this in April 2019. It is now September 2020 and the headlights are starting to appear cloudy again. I followed all the steps, this took 2-3 hours to polish, mask, then apply the chemical treatment. And it didn't last! For safety, the headlights should be clear and I'm not going to do this every year! Next time I see one of those places that will polish the headlights for $70, I'm going for it. Overall, disappointed in the performance of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Longhair

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I was told I would need a headlight restoration for my car inspection and was quoted close to $200 and didn’t want to pay that much for something I felt that I may be able to do myself. Found this and I must say I understand all the raving reviews! It’s an excellent product and delivered its advertised results! I cannot speak for the longevity of the product so I will update in the near future. It was easy to use with simple instructions. I would buy again in the future and/or recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It's all in the coating...
customer_reviews.text: Just tried this so don't know about it's longevity but the result's have been amazing. I used other kits before and they all polish the plastic back to like new condition but the coating that goes on with this product turns the lenses into what seems like glass. Granted I have narrow lenses on a mid 90's car so the finish may vary but for the first time the light is so clean and white, I can actually adjust the headlights by seeing the 'spots' on the road. There better than new...!
customer_reviews.author: i_taz

customer_reviews.title: Used Twice on Two Different Teen Cars
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this product twice on two of my daughters' beater cars to restore the headlights from that awful yellow glazing to a crystal clear finish. Both times, the process took about an hour for both headlights. If you take your time and follow the instructions, you'll be satisfied with the result. Obviously, the 1 star reviewers didn't do a good job. For the price and the time required, there's no reason not to perform this task. Why not take care of this and significantly increase your visibility and safety at night?
customer_reviews.author: The Bohn's

customer_reviews.title: did not think it would work this well!!
customer_reviews.text: wish i would of taken a before picture, but i did not think it would work this well! this headlight was completely yellow and so cloudy. i mean completely fogged over. and look at it now!! it looks brand new ( for a 12 year old car). i tried one other kit, and it was junk. this is the way to go!!
customer_reviews.author: looneytunes

customer_reviews.title: My headlights are very clear now
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like rubbing it over and over again with the sand paper. I followed the instructions making small circular motions for 5 minutes with each granulation type of sand paper per headlight. It made the headlight even more foggy, but then you apply the magic juice at the end and it is crystal clear! Works really well. My arm is sore now though LOL :)
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Only comment is... make sure you put on a heavy even coat of the UV coating!! It took 6 months to see the low spots. It looks like the areas were I started the application have become opaque. No yellowing at all. Maybe I didn’t clean the headlights enough? I would recommend this product, but follow the directions to the letter for best results! Oh and make sure you throughly shake the contents of the UV coating or else you get lumps!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Restores 20-year-old Honda headlamps to new appearance
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, good instructions. FOLLOW THEM, particularly the part about masking off (tape not included) painted surrounding surfaces. I didn't comment on the durability of the product, as I've only gone a few months and a couple of automatic car washes on the restoration, but so far, so good. Don't waste your money on kits that don't contain a final top coating and applicator. UPDATE: one year after restoration, and the lamps are still clear. They look like new, despite many automatic car washes. The car is parked outside; no yellowing of lenses. Five-star review.
customer_reviews.author: baltobernie

customer_reviews.title: Clears the headlights
customer_reviews.text: I have had my headlight foggy with some yellow tint for some time and it really was blocking light causing low visibility at night time. I stared to just buy some new headlight because of the year of my car I figured it might just need some new headlights. When I looked up the headlights for my Benz and seen they were going for 300+ used I decided why not give these a try. Boy am I glad I did my headlight were clear after giving them some good sanding and following the instructions provided. The only downside I had was there were streaks on the lights when finished
customer_reviews.author: Dominic swasey

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it actually works!
customer_reviews.text: I was highly skeptical, but holy cow, it works. Lenses on a 12-yr. old Honda Odyssey look every bit as clear as my neighbor's brand new Odyssey. Regardless of whether it results in brighter/clearer output, the front of my car no longer looks like it has cataracts. There's lots of good application tips in other reviews, but I'll add: don't use all the Step 1 cleaning spray, because you'll need it later. Read ALL the instructions before proceeding, and don't despair before the clear coat goes on. Your lenses will look terrible, and then POOF, magic.
customer_reviews.author: The Burgermuffin

customer_reviews.title: Complete headlight restoration kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 kits, one for a 2006 Camry, the other 2010 Highlander. Both had cloudy headlights. Unlike some kits this one starts with a cleaner before going thru 3 increasing grades of sandpaper. Reapply the cleaner before adding the clear coat. I spent about 30 min on each vehicle between the cleaner, wet sanding and finishing. Each step is important, especially the sealer. While some people use toothpaste or WD-40, without a clear coat, you work will get glazed over and your back to square one. Good product, would buy again but I don't expect to do so because I expect it to work for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: ka boom
customer_reviews.text: What a great product! My lights look like new and as a bonus the kit is supposed to treat one pair of lights, however, I used only the minimum amount required to complete 1 pair of lights, then tackled another pair and was able to complete 3 pairs of lights total. Highly recommended. If you use my technique be sure to complete each pair of lights thru the final step before going to the next pair, that way you'll be able to see how much treatment materials that you have left to determine if you have enough to continue. I was also able to find a yourtube video that showed me each step.
customer_reviews.author: Mick Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My headlights were almost no use at all. They had a thick white crust on them. I called the Honda dealer, and they said it would be almost $900 to replace both front headlights. So I ordered this. They aren't "good as new" but they are perfectly fine and greatly improved. It took me almost an hour to do both headlights (there are 4 times you need to rub or sand for 5 minutes per headlight and my arms were pretty tired.) The directions were easy to follow. I wish I took a "before". I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MBS

customer_reviews.title: Stop reading and buy it--really
customer_reviews.text: Read the headline. I have a show car that had minimal lens clouding, but it costs a fortune to replace the headlight assembly in this vehicle. It wasn't bad, but the car is so pretty that it was a distraction. I wavered for weeks before I finally decided to sit down and do this. I'm glad I did. The headlights look like new. I mean like right off the showroom floor first day driven new. It could be black magic, but it worked great for me. I"ll update if things change over time.
customer_reviews.author: Turk

customer_reviews.title: Cleared up a once foggy mess
customer_reviews.text: Used this kit on a 2006 MDX with original front lenses. Both lenses were badly hazed and the use of headlights while driving was not very effective. I followed the direction as written. The entire process took less than 20 minutes. The results are now clear lenses that I am certain will help while driving at night. I would guess 90%+ as new? Pretty happy with this product. Found it to be the best value on Amazon at the time of purchase. I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Baron

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It took about 20 mins to finish both headlights. I chose this kit because it has the UV coat, which I hope to offer useful protection in the blazing Phoenix sun. Make sure you have a water hose or a gallon or water handy because you will be using a lot of water in the process. The instructions are easy to follow and straight forward. Besides the paste, the kit seems enough to do 4 or more headlights. I had plenty of UV coat left so I used it on my other car which has newer headlights.
customer_reviews.author: Maselko

customer_reviews.title: Headlight looks like new
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions exactly and my completely fogged over headlight looks bright, shiny & brand new. It took a little elbow grease, but this kit worked great! My only suggestion is to take great care in applying the UV Block Clear Coat at the end making sure to not re-apply to any treated areas. I did a small spot without thinking and it's not as clear & shiny as the rest of the light. Thank goodness it's towards the bottom edge & not really noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue6

customer_reviews.title: Watch the video. Do all three steps. Results astounding!
customer_reviews.text: Used the Sylvania kit on badly oxidized headlights, easily five years worth of film. The kit comes with everything you need except paper towels and water to rinse. I suggest watching the official Sylvania how to video as it mirrors exactly the written instructions. If you do that it will take you 30-45 minutes. There are three steps and the lights stay filmy through the first two. Do not fret. When you apply the clear coat in step three the headlights literally transform in front of your eyes like an infomercial. Astounding. We shall see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Byers

customer_reviews.title: Best cleaner by far.
customer_reviews.text: I had seen a few you tube videos on the best cleaning products and the Sylvania kept on coming up with great reviews. It was pretty easy to apply and the end results were great. Make sure you have a water hose or spray bottle to keep the headlight lubricated while your using the sandpaper. I'll be ordering another kit to do my other car.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Escalera

customer_reviews.title: Good product, Make sure to read all instructions carefully.
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time redoing headlights, and even though I had a couple issues doing these, it was my fault for not reading the instructions carefully enough. I started sanding the first phase of this kit dry, which was a big mistake. My sanding pads got gummed up with melted plastic, and then I read that it's meant to be wet sanded. Oops. Went back and started over with wet sanding and the rest went smoothly. I only have after pics, but I am really happy with the result. These were not in the worst shape to begin with, but the tops of my lenses were in bad shape, and now they look perfect again.
customer_reviews.author: Polishskaterguy

customer_reviews.title: BAD BAD INSTRUCTIONS 1 2 3 NEEDS TO BE REMOVED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this back in 2014, but never used it, because I replaced my lenses. One of the lenses, now about 5 years old, had a minor issue. Now a major issue!I followed the 3 EASY STEPS, not realizing there were detailed steps inside, until I had already started sanding. I ended up screwing up my lens. It had a minor area that needed attention. Unbelievable that they have the "Simple 1 2 3" Instructions on the box. They need to remove them and then pay for a new lens! Really aggravated with Sylvania right now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used
customer_reviews.text: Warning: Using this product requires effort. Your arm may be sore at the end of the process - especially if your headlights are super dull. Sanding each light for several minutes with four different grits of sandpaper followed by polishing compound and then the sealer coat. Take your time and don't skimp on the sanding process. You will get out of it what you put into it. The final results will amaze you. Crystal clear and sparkly lights. The UV coating is what sets this apart from the others, as it really keeps them clear. The first time I used this was 8 years ago and those lights are still nice and clear!
customer_reviews.author: Erok Magnag

customer_reviews.title: Easier to apply than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I researched a number of products, most more expensive, and settled on this one. I bought two kits since some reviews indicated that this was just enough for two headlights. One kit is more than enough, I could have done 4 to 6 headlights (at least for a VW Golf). I was not sold on the idea of using the included paper towel as the applicator, but I followed the instructions and it worked flawlessly. Very easy to do, took me about an hour to finish both headlights. Still look great 2 months later.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it really gave a nice finish
customer_reviews.text: this stuff is a bit difficult to apply since you have one chance to quickly apply the coat. honestly if there was a version with spray application it would have been easier to do. but anyway it comes with three servings. so you can do three sets of headlights. I think I might just try to do mine with three layers over a three month period. with each application a month apart. I used it after using the 3M headlight restoration kit as a finishing touch and it really set it off nice.
customer_reviews.author: mikesoops

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market!
customer_reviews.text: Imho Sylvannia is leader in headlight restoration kits. Easy to use and effective. Like 6mo old lenses on a 06 Jetta. I'm impressed. Sister recommended Sylvannia after i had tried two other products and this is definately the cats meow! Pulled over for High beams and lights werent even on, just kidding. I would Highly recommend this kit if you have sandpaper otherwise order the complete kit. Their activator is the key, smells like a ketone, acetone? Idk was unable to trace patent or description on website. It works whatever it is.
customer_reviews.author: Jay E

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had the instructions in the photos before I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: They say 3 steps, the instructions say 5, several of them specifying 5 or 10 minutes of rubbing with sand paper and only a single glove, and that's just one headlight, then you repeat it all for the fellow light. There are no temperature specifications to inform as to if there are limitations for when you should do this, either negating that factor or suggesting that whether 100 degrees F or 20 degrees F, the product will work adequately as well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D Crown

customer_reviews.title: Saves you hundreds!!
customer_reviews.text: I just finished applying the product onto my vehicle headlights and I'm shocked on the results. They look brand new now!! The instructions are easy to follow and it also give you a link to watch a video too. Definitely put some elbow grease into this project to receive amazing results! Also be careful with the final part adding the clear coat. It will smudge if you try to go over again and you wi have re-do the steps. But other than that, this product definitely deserves a five star rating! My pictures are a before and after as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Restores brightness
customer_reviews.text: The process to restore headlight brightness took about an hour and a half and was successful. The company has a short video on YouTube that provides a very good understanding of how to use the product. My use of the product completely restored brightness to the lights, however there is a slight line across one of the lenses because I did not apply the last reconditioner product evenly. I have no experience with the longevity of this treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Cyclist

customer_reviews.title: Best Do-It-Yourself Headlight Restoration Kit on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these kits ever since they came on the market a few years ago. It takes me about 30 minutes to do a pair of car headlights. There are several YouTube videos demonstrating on how to use the kit. In my experience, the restoration lasts about a year before the headlights begin to fog again. Much cheaper than replacement headlights and worth using as long as your old headlights can be restored using the kit. Very satisfied with the product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: 10th Legion

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last...
customer_reviews.text: For the price and (my)labor it almost wasn't worth it. Looked good for a few months but within a year started clouding/corroding again and by two years was right back to where they started. Also, this was on a car that was in the garage 60%-70% of the time so very little sun exposure. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sonkisst09

customer_reviews.title: I can see clearly now
customer_reviews.text: Product worked as advertised. Suggest watching a couple YouTube videos about this product to get the steps clear. Very important to follow instructions. And unbox your patience...you will need to sand the headlight covers for about an hour total (3 different grits). Don't cut the sanding short - it's what makes the product work. Cost for kit MUCH less than having a pro do it, or having the covers replaced. NOTE: the covers will look cloudy after each sanding but that's OK...the final step is the application of the clear coat which makes the covers crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Space Ranger

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS! But follow instructions explicitly.
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical as I had tried several kits before on other cars with mediocre results at best. I used it on a 2006 Volvo S60 I had bought for commuting. It still had original headlights. It was in pretty sad shape. To the point I thought if I can’t restore I need to replace. After reading reviews and searching I chose the Sylvania. Got it and I followed the. Instructions explicitly. I was astounded at the results. It was not like new, but it was phenomenally better for a 12 year old car. I highly recommend it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Great results
customer_reviews.text: Needed good amount of efforts but the results were unbelievable. However it is not 10 minutes job! One has to spent good two hours of your time for this. Also the process has to be completed until end to see the results. I was really skeptical the way it was looking after every step since the first step actually worsened the headlamp look; but the last two steps in the instructions brought up the amazing final outcome. Definitely saves those dollars that one might have planned to spend on headlamp restoration!
customer_reviews.author: akhildeep

customer_reviews.title: First the instructions are not very clear and easy to follow on the last step
customer_reviews.text: I didn't mind all the work and many steps which take up to 1/2 hr to 1 hr. The last step they need to improve. First the instructions are not very clear and easy to follow on the last step. You really don't want to over lap AT ALL. Just one pass is all you get. Don't put on too much or it will streak and drip, don't put on too little or it won't cover. You have one shot and one pass and hope it goes on well or it will leave streak marks and your stuck, not fix or remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Murch

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This worked very well & was relatively easy to use. I took before/after photos but won't bother posting as there are several other reviews that have those. I can attest that those photos reflect my results. I did one side & hubby did the other. Took about 30-45 minutes total. The directions recommend having a spray bottle of water handy. We had that and a hose w/sprayer. Ending up using the hose only. You need that extra water pressure. My only complaint is that the kit does NOT contain a roll of protective tape as stated in the instruction section so you would need to make sure you have that ready.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My car is 15 yrs. old and the headlights were heavily hazed. I tried various quick fixes and even a different kit but none of them worked very well. This stuff worked great, easy to use and everything supplied in one kit. My headlights look almost like new! My friends have even noticed and been asking what I used. I can't speak about longevity for the product because it's only been about a month. But, I've very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Ter

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders!
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical about buying this product...my headlight covers were hazed (2002 Dodge 3500 Ram) and it was very difficult to see the road clearly at night. I had decided to replace the halogen light bulbs with LED. Decided I would give the Sylvania kit a try, if it didn't work I would just buy new headlight covers. Long story short....Took very little time. easy to use, instructions well written and easy to follow...headlight covers now LIKE NEW. Couldn't believe a kit would work this well. Great product! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: buccaneer

customer_reviews.title: Back to factory new
customer_reviews.text: It took me about 20minutes to do both headlights on my FJ. Throughout the wet sanding process I was sure the scratch marks were never going to come out of the headlights. But after applying the clear coat the results were fantastic. Nearly back to factory new except I had a difficult time applying the clear coat on my round headlights (you're only supposed to over lap minimally and you only are supposed to make one pass). It likely would have been better if I had used half of the applicator sheet to allow for a more technical application. No worries, they look great and worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this kit because my car is 10 years old and the oxidation on the headlights were really bad. The instructions are really easy to follow and I took my time to make sure I did it correctly since this was my first time ever doing anything like this to my car. The first picture is after I did one headlight and the second picture is after I completely finished all of the steps. Makes my car look like it did when I bought it off the lot!!! I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this product as worked amazingly with my headlights looking like new. I did exactly as instructed which were 3 easy steps to follow. I wet sanded with water constantly running over my head light for at least 5 minutes with each sheet. I actually had left over clear coat from step 3 so I used it on my friends headlights. I didn't have any step one activator left, but we just wet sanded like the instructions said for 5 minutes with each sheet and then applied the clear coat. They too came out amazingly......I highly recommend this product as you too will be satisfied with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: This kit works and lasts
customer_reviews.text: This product is legit. I have tried on several occasions using a few different restoration kits and sadly none of them held for any length of time. This kit worked well, it took a little effort but if you follow the directions correctly it will work. Six months later my headlights still look brand new
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Headlights look great after using this kit! Not very hard, does require some time, sanding steps are very important - don't skimp on the sanding. Yes, I can tell which headlight I did first, with more energy spent on the sanding, but the second headlight looks fine too. I read about this on Consumer Reports and decided to give it a try, cheaper than new headlights, even if it does not work. But it does work and I am impressed. I will certainly use this again, if needed, and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: CTW_TX

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous product
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to spend some time and effort into restoring your headlight covers when using this kit, but it's well worth it. I wish I had a photo of the "before" because the lenses were really yellow and cloudy. The instructions are terrific with explanations of each step, and descriptions of what to expect at each stage. I'm getting a kit for my daughter who has super-cloudy lenses. The idea of sanding the lenses is a little scary, but it works. Can't recommend the kit highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: A. Saunders
